homeHeader.title: From Trade License to Office Space Setup, Get End-to-End Support & Launch Faster in Sharjah With One Nexuz
homeHeader.description: High setup costs and compliance hurdles can slow down your entry into Sharjah’s booming market. From low startup costs to full market access, licensing, documentation, and hassle-free setup, One Nexuz unifies every step you need to establish your business in Sharjah with speed and confidence. Whether you’re a first-time entrepreneur or an expanding enterprise, our expert-led solutions put your growth, compliance, and success in one seamless process.

leftSection_3.title: Types of Legal Structures for Sharjah Mainland Company Setup

items.title: LLC
items.description: The most common choice, an LLC, allows about 1-50 shareholders, unmatched visa eligibility, and unlimited flexibility.

items.title: Partnership Company
items.description: Well-suited for UAE nationals, a partnership company offers shared ownership between two or more entrepreneurs.

items.title: Sole Proprietorship
items.description: Ideal for solopreneurs and foreign investors, a sole proprietorship provides folks with full ownership and control.

items.title: Public/Partner Shareholding Company
items.description: Best suited for large enterprises, this legal structure allows entrepreneurs to share liability and gain public investments.

leftSection_5.title: Our 6-Step Seamless Process for Company Setup in Sharjah Mainland

items.title: Book a Free Consultation
items.description: Our expert consultants take the time to understand your business vision and objectives, recommending the most suitable Sharjah Mainland structure and license type to ensure compliance and long-term success.

items.title: Curate a Unique Trade Name
items.description: We help you craft and register a trade name that reflects your brand identity. From submission to approval, our team ensures smooth filings with the Sharjah Economic Development Department (SEDD).

items.title: Compile All Relevant Documents
items.description: Forget the hassle of paperwork—we guide you in preparing, collecting, and submitting all required documents, including your Memorandum of Association (MOA) and sponsor agreements where necessary.

items.title: Secure Your Mainland License
items.description: Once approvals are in place, our consultants help you obtain your Sharjah Mainland trade license—often within 1–7 working days—so you can officially start operations without delay.

items.title: Apply for the Right Visa
items.description: Through our integrated PRO and immigration support, we handle your visa processing smoothly, whether it’s investor, partner, or employee visas, based on your office size and license type.

items.title: Enjoy Post-Licensing Support
items.description: Our support doesn’t end with license issuance—we assist with opening a compliant corporate bank account, VAT registration, and ongoing renewals so your business continues to run seamlessly.

faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: How long does it take to set up a mainland business in Sharjah?
items.answer: Most Sharjah Mainland businesses can be set up in 5-7 working days, depending on the document readiness, trade name reservation, and initial approvals.

items.question: Can expats own 100% of my Sharjah mainland company?
items.answer: Yes, under the updated UAE laws, you can enjoy 100% foreign ownership across most business activities.

items.question: What documents do I need to start a Sharjah Mainland company?
items.answer: You primarily need passport copies, an Emirates ID, business name options, and a signed lease agreement. Additionally, you may be required to provide additional documents based on your unique business activities.

items.question: Can I operate across the UAE using a Sharjah Mainland license?
items.answer: Yes, unlike free zone licenses, a Sharjah Mainland license allows you to conduct business across the Emirate hassle-free.

items.question: Is a physical office space mandatory to run my Sharjah Mainland license?
items.answer: Yes, a physical office or co-working space lease is necessary to obtain a Sharjah Mainland license. You can partner with our experts to reduce initial costs.
